intro: Salpichroa lehmannii, commonly known as Lehmann's blueweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. It has slender stems and finely divided leaves, and it produces small, spherical fruits. Salpichroa lehmannii is an annual herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil in arid environments.
